item.title: Things Puppet won't tell you about Deferred
item.description: You might've heard about one of Puppet 6's freshfeatures: Deferred. It basically allows you to run code on agent during execution, instead of only on master during compilation. It's awesome for many reasons; you can: retrieve secrets on agents, implement lazy execution and macros, But it has one big problem. Let me show what's wrong. Usage Try writing an example code with Deferred: # manifest.pp$args = { now_on_master => new(TimeStamp), shadow_contents => Deferred('file', ['/etc/puppet_time.
